column4: Hello all, need some help with a partition resize that's frozen...
I was following the guide here: https://help.ubuntu.com/community/HowToRemoveWindows
Got about 3/4 through the resize and everything froze.  Mouse cursor responds but that's it...
how long has it been frozen?
I would wait a little longer before killing it
Yeah, I'm hoping it comes back to life.  If it doesn't... ? I did back up my home dir.  How long to wait?
another 15-20 minutes and if it still isn't done then I guess you can kill it and hope for the best but like you said you did the smart thing and backed up :)
Yeah, just hope the backup works.  (I did do a test partial restore beforehand.)  Does killing it mean hard power-off?
are you able to get a TTY ( ctrl-alt-F1) ctrl-alt-F7 to get back to GUI
No, can't get TTL.  Ctrl-Alt-F1 does nothing.
umm yeah hard shut down I guess.
tvaughn has a better idea. sorry I didn't think of it first
that is the exact reason why we ask people to stay in the channel when asking for help :) so that others can peer review and make sure no bad advice is given
you can type lsb_release -a in a terminal to see your version
I don't see that you have any other choice
what should I expect?  Will I need to reinstall from scratch?
you were formatting a windows partition correct?
yes
ok and you already have ubuntu installed and booting properly?
yes
you should be fine but you probably will need to format that partition again
whew.  I hope that's the case.  Thanks!
